Activity: Log in, check emails. Black coffee, no sugar.
Review the character blockouts. Have there been any answers on the email?
Assuming there's no feedback from the concept artist yet, start blocking out the environment. Begin with the larger structures like buildings and rock formations.
Research reference images for the environment. Gather inspiration from real-world architecture and natural landscapes.
Create a new Blender project for the environment. Set up scale and establish the overall scene composition.
Begin blocking out the main buildings using simple cube shapes. Focus on getting the overall scale and placement correct.
Block out any major terrain features like hills or valleys. Use simple mesh deformation techniques to create these shapes.
Lunch Break. Need a hearty meal today.
Continue blocking out the environment. Add details to the buildings like window placements and roof structures.
Start placing placeholder assets like trees and rocks to populate the scene. This helps to get a sense of the overall environment density.
Save the environment blockout as 'environment_blockout_v01.blend'. Document any issues encountered or design considerations.
Wrap up for the day. Prepare for tomorrow's tasks.
